attributes.comment:
I can understand the need to periodically raise fees for government services, but
what I do not agree with is raising fees in conjunction with the expiration of the I-
171H and the biometric fingerprints (which happen to expire at different times) and
requiring reapplication with a second set of fees.

People in the process of adopting children from China are now waiting up to 20+
months for a child match, and when these documents expire, it poses a
significant hardship to reapply for the I-171H. Not only are the fees paid a second
time, but all of the time and paperwork involved to reacquire necessary documents
and update the homestudy are truly burdensome and unnecessary - particularly
when fingerprints don't actually expire!

Before raising fees across the board - please think this process through to the end
and make some allowances for people trying to adopt internationally.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted Kim A. Obele
